intro: Ailanthus peregrina, commonly known as the wandering ailanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the Simaroubaceae family. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other regions, though it can become invasive in some areas.
